data.name: RemoveFlashingToolTip
data.value: Removes rapid flashing that sometimes appears in the base game.

data.name: DisableHUDFlashonLagToolTip
data.value: Prevents the HUD from flying all over the place when lag happens. Does not actually reduce the amount of lag.

data.name: FastSpellCastingToolTip
data.value: If selected, you can press select to cast a spell multiple times without re-entering the menu.

data.name: RemapUpAtoUpSelectonController1ToolTip
data.value: Changes the control to automatically game over/reset from Up+A on the 2P controller to Up+Select on the 1P controller while paused.

data.name: BeepThresholdToolTip
data.value: Controls how many bars of health Link has before the warning beep will start.

data.name: BeepFrequencyToolTip
data.value: Controls how frequently the warning beep will chime. (Including never)

data.name: UseCommunityTextToolTip
data.value: The text for many of the NPCs is replaced with text submitted by the community.

data.name: DisableMusicToolTip
data.value: Disables in-game music

data.name: UseCustomMusicIfAnyToolTip
data.value: Enables playing custom music tracks. Music will be randomly selected from any music libraries found in the Music directory. See the Wiki for information on how to set this up.

data.name: MixCustomandOriginalMusicToolTip
data.value: Also include original tracks in the selection when using custom music. If disabled, original tracks will only be selected when no custom tracks exist for a given usage.

data.name: IncludeDiverseMusicToolTip
data.value: Include music tracks that do not fit the fantasy setting of the game (tracks with the "diverse" tag). This can potentially increase the number of tracks in libraries that may be selected.

data.name: DisableUnsafeMusicToolTip
data.value: Disable songs in the library that are marked as being potentially unsafe for streaming.

data.name: CharacterSpriteToolTip
data.value: Selects which sprite to replace Link with. All sprites have the same hitbox / stats and are purely cosmetic. Many sprites are provided, but if you have a different sprite you want to play as, you can add a .IPS file containing the necessary graphics to the Sprites folder and it will automatically be added to the list on restart.

data.name: ChangeItemSpritesToolTip
data.value: Some custom character sprites include modified item graphics. If you find this confusing or undesirable, you can disable it here.

data.name: TunicColorToolTip
data.value: Changes the base color of the sprite. This is the color the Shield spell will replace.

data.name: SkinToneToolTip
data.value: Changes the skin tone in Link's sprite.

data.name: TunicOutlineColorToolTip
data.value: Changes the tunic outline color in Link's sprite.

data.name: ShieldColorToolTip
data.value: Changes the base color of the character sprite when the shield spell is cast.

data.name: BeamSpriteToolTip
data.value: Changes the sprite of Link's sword beams.

data.name: ShuffleItemDropFrequencyToolTip
data.value: If selected, the frequency at which drops appear is changed from every 6 enemies to every 4-8 enemies, chosen at random.

data.name: RandomizeDropsToolTip
data.value: If selected, each item in each pool that is unselected also has a 50% chance to be added to the drop pool. Selected items are still 100% to be the drop pool. If no items are selected, randomize drops will ensure at least 1 item is in each drop pool.

data.name: StandardizeDropsToolTip
data.value: Instead of a random item from the pool dropping, items will always drop in a predefined sequence specific to the seed.

data.name: ShuffleOverworldEnemiesToolTip
data.value: Shuffles which enemies appear in each non-palace encounter. Enemies can still only appear on the continents they normally appear on.

data.name: ShufflePalaceEnemiesToolTip
data.value: Shuffles which enemies appear in each palace room. Enemies can still only appear within the palace group they normally appear in (1/2/5, 3/4/6, and GP)

data.name: ShuffleDripperEnemyToolTip
data.value:
Randomizes which enemies can spawn from drippers in palaces.
The enemy that appears normally has the HP of a Bot, unless you enable the Full HP option.
Easier Ground Enemies include: small enemies, Tinsuits, orange Iron Knuckles, and both Stalfos. (With Full HP enabled, armored Stalfos from drippers will use the unarmored HP value.)

data.name: MixLargeandSmallEnemiesToolTip
data.value: Normally, when shuffling enemies small enemies are replaced by small and large enemies are replaced by large. With this flag, any small or large enemy can be replaced with any large or small enemy. Flying enemies are still only replaced with other flying enemies.

data.name: GeneratorsAlwaysMatchToolTip
data.value: When rooms have infinitely spawning enemies this flag ensures the spawner on the left and right side of the room are always the same.

data.name: RandomizeKnockbackToolTip
data.value: Greatly changes knockback in unpredictable ways. This is not limited to knockback from taking damage. Play at your own risk.

data.name: ShuffleEnemyHPToolTip
data.value: If selected, each enemy type will have between 50% and 150% of its vanilla HP value.

data.name: ShuffleBossHPToolTip
data.value:
Choose how boss HP is randomized. HP will always be capped at 255.
Great Palace bosses are not included.

data.name: ShuffleWhichEnemiesStealEXPToolTip
data.value: Randomly reassigns which enemies steal EXP. The number of enemies that steal EXP in each group is the same as the number in that group that steal EXP in vanilla.

data.name: ShuffleAmountofEXPStolenToolTip
data.value: If selected, the amount of EXP each stealer steals is between 50% and 150% of the vanilla amount.

data.name: ShuffleSwordImmunityToolTip
data.value: Randomly reassigns which enemies are immune to stabs. The number of enemies that are immune in each group is the same as the number in that group that are immune in vanilla.

data.name: ShuffleSpritePalettesToolTip
data.value: Randomizes the colors each of the enemies are. This could cause which enemies are visible in the dark to change.

data.name: EnemyExperienceDropsToolTip
data.value:
Controls how much experience enemies give.
The possible experience values for an enemy are:
0, 2, 3, 5, 10, 20, 30, 50, 70, 100, 150, 200, 300, 500, 700, 1000.
When XP is randomized, the enemy's XP value shifts left or right in this list by the rolled number of steps.
For example, a Blue Stalfos gives 50 XP in the vanilla game. If the XP is rolled -2 to +2 levels, the minimum XP it could give is 20 and the maximum is 100.
Also note that XP values are randomized per enemy table and can differ in a single seed. For example Red Iron Knuckle XP in P1/P2/P5 could roll down while Red Iron Knuckle XP in P3/P4/P6 rolls up.

data.name: EnableHelpfulHintsToolTip
data.value: When enabled, helpful hints are scattered throughout the world. These hints are provided either by townspeople (stationary NPCs only) or by written text on walls. All hint locations correspond to places where readable text appears in the vanilla game. See the Wiki for more details.

data.name: EnableSpellItemHintsToolTip
data.value:
When enabled, if visiting a spell location without the required quest item:
• The blocking lady in Ruto, Mido, and Darunia will give a hint to the required item's location (Trophy, Medicine, and Child). • With Include Town Quest Items in Shuffle enabled, this also applies to Saria (Mirror) and Nabooru (Water). • With Include Sword Techniques in Shuffle enabled, you can get hints about the locations of Downstab and Upstab by talking to the closed door of the Mido Church and the Upstab knight's house in Darunia.

data.name: EnableTownNameHintsToolTip
data.value: The town entrance sign for each town will display the item or spell given by that town's wizard.

data.name: GenerateSpoilerToolTip
data.value:
Generates two files alongside the randomized ROM:
• spoiler.txt - summary of all item locations and ASCII-drawn palace maps. • spoiler.png - map of the generated world.
⚠️ A spoiler seed is generated differently from a non-spoiler seed. It is not possible to retroactively generate a spoiler file for a non-spoiler seed.

data.name: RevealWalkthroughWallsToolTip
data.value: Replaces all false wall and floor tiles with background tiles.

data.name: ShufflePalaceItemsToolTip
data.value: Each normal palace contains exactly one item room. When selected, this shuffles which item is available in this palace with a different palace item, or with a general item if "Mix Overworld and Palace Items" is selected.

data.name: ShuffleOverworldItemsToolTip
data.value: Shuffles all of the items available in the overworld with other overworld items (or with a general item if "Mix Overworld and Palace Items" is selected). This includes: • 4 caves and the grass tile on the west continent • Hammer Cave and the boulder-blocked drop on Death Mountain • Water tile, desert tile, and 2 New Kasuto items on the east continent • 2 drop tiles on Maze Island

data.name: MixOverworldandPalaceItemsToolTip
data.value: Normally palace items will only appear in palaces and non-palace items only outside of palaces. This setting allows all items to be found anywhere.

data.name: IncludePBagCavesinItemShuffleToolTip
data.value: Adds the 1 cave in the west and the 2 caves on the east that normally contain P-Bags to the item pool. Those locations can contain any item and 3 P-Bags (2 medium and 1 large) are added to the pool of possible items.

data.name: IncludeSpellsinShuffleToolTip
data.value: Allows the 8 wizards in town who grant spells to instead grant any item, and adds all 8 spells to the pool of items that can appear in general locations.

data.name: IncludeSwordTechniquesinShuffleToolTip
data.value: Allows the sword technique teachers in Mido and Darunia to instead grant any item, and adds the Up and Down stabs to the general item pool.

data.name: IncludeTownQuestItemsinShuffleToolTip
data.value: Adds the mirror (allowing the spell in Saria), and the water (allowing the spell in Nabooru) to be added to the general pool. An item from the general pool will replace the item you get when you check under the table, or check the fountain.

data.name: IncludeBagusNoteInShuffleToolTip
data.value: Adds Bagu's letter (allowing passage of the Saria moat) to the general pool. An item from the general pool will replace the item you get when you talk to Bagu.

data.name: TownQuestLocationsAreMinorItemsToolTip
data.value: With Town Quest Items and/or Sword Techniques shuffled, you can enable this option to avoid major items being shuffled into their locations. (This does not include Bagu.)

data.name: ShuffleSmallItemsToolTip
data.value: Replaces each small item (red/blue jar, key, 1-up, or P-Bag) with another random small item. This includes item locations in the shuffle pool and general locations not shuffled that contain small items.

data.name: StartWithSpellItemsToolTip
data.value: Link starts with the Trophy, Medicine, Child, Water, and Mirror and random small items are added to the item pool to replace the number of those items that were in the shuffle pool.

data.name: ShufflePBagAmountsToolTip
data.value: If selected, each of the 4 P-Bag sizes is assigned a new experience value between +2 and -2 levels of the vanilla value.

data.name: PalacesContainExtraKeysToolTip
data.value: If selected, all small items in palaces are replaced by keys.

data.name: RandomizeNewKasutoJarRequirementsToolTip
data.value: Randomizes the requirement to access the New Kasuto basement from 5 to 7 Magic Containers. If you have insufficient containers, the lady blocking the door will tell you the requirement.

data.name: AllowDuplicatesofImportantItemsToolTip
data.value:
After the normal item shuffle is done, this feature will go through the items, and make one copy of each important item, replacing minor items (like P-Bags), as space allows. There can only be as many duplicates as there are minor items to replace.
What is duplicated, in order (and if they are in the pool) is: Glove, Downstab, Fairy, Thunder, Reflect, Magic key, Hammer, Raft, Flute, Jump, Upstab, Boots

data.name: ShuffleAllExperienceToolTip
data.value: Shuffles the experience required to gain each level of the selected attribute. The new EXP requirement is +/- up to 25% of the vanilla requirement. The "Shuffle all Experience" box just checks all 3 shuffle EXP boxes.

data.name: LevelCapToolTip
data.value:
Sets a maximum level for the specified attribute. Any levels gained beyond this cap will instead grant 1-ups.
Note: When a stat is capped below level 8 and reaches its maximum, you can no longer skip the level-up screen to keep gaining experience for that attribute. To stay consistent with the vanilla game, this behavior is still allowed if the cap is set to 8.
(The point of this limitation is to allow for lower max stat levels to increase challenge, but not have this be exploited to reach high amounts of exp quickly using palace crystals.)

data.name: ScaleLevelRequirementstoCapToolTip
data.value: If selected, the experience requirement for each level will increase to be proportional to what percentage of the max level it represents

data.name: AttackEffectivenessToolTip
data.value:
Determines how effective Link's sword attack is. In all cases, the damage of the next attack level is at least the same as the previous, even if randomized.
Vanilla: Identical to an unrandomized game.
Low Attack: Each attack level deals 50% less than the vanilla value. For levels 1-6, this is specifically 1 damage per level.
Randomize (Low): Each attack level is between 50% and 100% of the vanilla value. Level 2 is at least 2 damage.
Randomize: Each attack level is between 67% and 150% of the vanilla value. Level 1 is at least 2 damage.
Randomize (High): Each attack level is between 100% and 150% of the vanilla value.
High Attack: Each attack level is 150% of the vanilla value.
Instant Kill: All sword attacks will instantly kill all enemies, regardless of level.

data.name: MagicEffectivenessToolTip
data.value:
Determines the cost of spells. Each spell's cost at each level is guaranteed to be at most the same cost as the previous level, even if randomized. When randomized, the cost of each spell is randomized separately. The maximum cost for any spell is 120MP (7.5 bars) even if a setting would cause it to be more.
Vanilla: All spells cost the same as the base game.
High Spell Cost: Each spell is 150% of the vanilla cost.
Randomize (High Cost): Each spell is between 100% and 150% of the vanilla cost.
Randomize: Each spell is between 50% and 150% of the vanilla cost.
Randomize (Low Cost): Each spell is between 50% and 100% of the vanilla cost.
Low Spell Cost: Each spell is 50% of the vanilla cost.
Free Spells: Spells do not cost MP and can be cast an unlimited number of times.

data.name: LifeEffectivenessToolTip
data.value:
Each life level controls the amount of damage Link takes from each of the 7 different randomizeable enemy damage groups. Each damage group is randomized separately. The amount of damage taken from a damage group is always at most the amount of the previous level. Enemies that do a constant damage regardless of Link's life level in vanilla are not effected by this setting and always deal their vanilla damage (except on Invincible)
Vanilla: Identical to an unrandomized game.
OHKO Link: Any damage will kill Link instantly. Good Luck.
Randomize (Low): Damage taken is between 100% and 150% of the vanilla amount.
Randomize: Damage taken is between 75% and 150% of the vanilla amount.
Randomize (High): Damage taken is between 75% and 100% of the vanilla amount.
High Defense: Damage taken is 50% of the vanilla amount.
Invincible: Link does not take damage. He can still be killed by effects that instantly kill.

data.name: AllowPalacestoSwapContinentsToolTip
data.value:
In vanilla, palaces 1, 2, and 3 are found on the west continent, 4 is on Maze Island, and 5, 6 are on the east continent. If enabled, any regular palace can be shuffled to any continent.
Each continent will still have the same number of palaces: 3 in the west, 1 on Maze Island, and 3 in the east.

data.name: IncludeGreatPalaceinShuffleToolTip
data.value:
If enabled, the Great Palace is included in the palace location shuffle, and can appear at any palace location (within the rules of "Allow Palaces to Swap Continents").
If disabled, the Great Palace will always be in the Valley of Death.

data.name: ShuffleEncountersToolTip
data.value: If enabled, which overworld encounters are on which terrain types are shuffled. For example you might get a swamp large enemy encounter from a small enemy on the desert.

data.name: AllowUnsafePathEncountersToolTip
data.value: If enabled, road tiles are also included in the encounter shuffle, meaning roads may be unsafe (and non-roads may be safe).

data.name: IncludeLavainShuffleToolTip
data.value: If enabled, lava tiles (like those in the Valley of Death) are also included in the encounter shuffle.

data.name: EncounterRateToolTip
data.value: Controls how frequently overworld enemies spawn. • On Half, both the timer encounter and step encounter take twice as long to trigger. • On None, no overworld enemies will spawn. (Trap tiles still function as normal). • On Random, one of the three other options will be selected at equal chance.

data.name: RiverDevilBlocksToolTip
data.value: Controls what the river devil in the east blocks. Blocks Path: River devil blocks a road/bridge. This is identical to how he worked in previous versions. Blocks Cave: River devil blocks a cave (either connection or item) somewhere in the east. That cave may or may not be required. Blocks Town: River devils have besieged a town and you'll need the flute to get past them. Remember to use the flute again on the way out.

data.name: AllowRockBlocksontheEastToolTip
data.value: If enabled, 0-2 of the path blocks on the east may be rocks.

data.name: RestrictConnectionCaveShuffleToolTip
data.value:
When this option is selected, passthrough caves will be placed in a more logical way, such that the entrance of a cave will point to where the other side of the cave is. For example, if you enter a cave going north, you know that when you exit the other side of the cave you will be directly north of where you went in. The distance between cave exits is also restricted, such that you can often see the exit before entering the cave.
It is not recommended to disable this.

data.name: AllowConnectionCavestoBeBlockedToolTip
data.value: If selected, caves that connect from one part of the continent to another or between continents can be blocked by rocks. Otherwise, rocks can only block item caves.

data.name: GenerateBagusWoodsToolTip
data.value:
If enabled, one of the woods in the west will have a cluster of encounters and Bagu's cabin similar to vanilla.
If disabled, Bagu's cabin is an isolated forest tile surrounded on all sides by other terrain.

data.name: LessImportantLocationsToolTip
data.value:
How to handle overworld tiles that contain minor things like red jars, fairies or P-bags.
Blend In: These tiles will be hidden among other tiles of the same terrain.
Isolate: These tiles will be surrounded on all sides by other terrain, just like major item location tiles.
Remove: Remove these tiles from the game.
Random: Pick one of the above at random.

data.name: AllWaterIsWalkableWithBootsToolTip
data.value: If enabled, all water tiles can be walked on with boots. If unselected, the only walkable water will be on water paths marked with a road tile on either end. This flag has no effect on the Vanilla or Vanilla(shuffle) biomes.

data.name: GenerateThreeEyedRockToolTip
data.value:
If enabled, one palace will be hidden beneath Three-Eyed Rock and will require the flute to access. Look for the same rock formation as in the vanilla game.
Which location is hidden beneath may change if Shuffle Which Locations Are Hidden is enabled.

data.name: GenerateHiddenKasutoTileToolTip
data.value:
If enabled, New Kasuto will be hidden beneath a forest tile somewhere in the east and will require the hammer to access. The hidden tile will always be a single forest tile surrounded by other terrain.
Which location is hidden beneath may change if Shuffle Which Locations Are Hidden is enabled.

data.name: ShuffleWhichLocationsAreHiddenToolTip
data.value: If enabled, what is hidden under Three-Eyed Rock and the New Kasuto forest tile can be any random location in the east.

data.name: OverworldSizeToolTip
data.value:
Set the size of a continent. With smaller sizes, some non-item tiles may be removed.
Note: The cave count does not include continent connector caves.

data.name: WestContinentBiomeToolTip
data.value: See the Wiki for a description of what each biome does.

data.name: EastContinentBiomeToolTip
data.value: See the Wiki for a description of what each biome does.

data.name: DeathMountainBiomeToolTip
data.value: See the Wiki for a description of what each biome does.

data.name: MazeIslandBiomeToolTip
data.value: See the Wiki for a description of what each biome does.

data.name: ClimateToolTip
data.value:
Where biome controls the shape of the continent, climate controls its composition. Note this option is still somewhat experimental and may cause unusual or extreme continents to be generated.
Classic: Each terrain type will appear at equal size / frequency. Just like older versions of the randomizer.
Vanilla-Weighted: Each terrain type will appear at the frequency they appear in the vanilla continent.
Chaos: The number of seed terrain tiles is massively increased, resulting in a more chaotic appearance. This option may cause seeds to take longer to generate.
Wetlands: Swampy and wet. Less desert, more/bigger swamps. Yay!
Great Lakes: Water is less frequent, but much larger. Enjoy more forests but not much desert.
Scrubland: Dry and open. More desert and no swamp, with scattered graves dotting the landscape.

data.name: ContinentConnectorsToolTip
data.value:
Controls how continents are connected to each other. There are always 2 connection caves, 1 bridge, and 1 raft connection between continents, but this option controls where they can be.
Normal: Like vanilla, there are always 2 caves between the West and Death Mountain, a raft between the West and East, and a bridge between the East and Maze Island.
Transportation shuffle: There are still 2 connections from West to Death Mountain, one from West to East, and one from East to Maze Island, but they can now be of any type.
Anything goes: The 4 connections can appear from any continent to any continent. The only restrictions are: • Each continent must be connected in a way that you can reach it eventually • If the raft and bridge appear on the same continent, they are never on the same side (North / South / East / West)

data.name: VanillaShuffleShowsActualTerrainToolTip
data.value:
If a shuffled vanilla map is used, this option will make the shuffled locations show their actual terrain, instead of the original vanilla terrain.
It is not recommended to disable this.

data.name: NormalPalaceStyleToolTip
data.value: Sets the palace generator for palaces 1 through 6. See the Wiki for more details.

data.name: ShortenToolTip
data.value: If selected, palaces will be fewer rooms. The exact way this is handled varies by palace style, but on average the palace is 25% to 50% fewer rooms than otherwise.

data.name: MinimumPathToDarkLinkToolTip
data.value:
If you think a short Great Palace at the end of the game is anticlimactic, this is the flag for you! The shortest path to Dark Link (and to finish the game) will be at least this many rooms from the entrance. (Doesn't affect Thunderbird.)
The Max option depends on the palace style and whether it's shortened. For example, Reconstructed palaces have connectors that lead anywhere in the palace. This often makes the shortest path shorter, so the max has to be lower.
This increases seed generation time if it's set high, as the palace will have to be regenerated a lot. Setting it very high also makes it likely the Great Palace is more linear.

root.data:
Lets you select the number of item rooms per palace: 0-2 or Random.
• Extra palace items (beyond the first) default to 200 P-Bags, but can be replaced or shuffled depending on other settings. • Vanilla palaces: Extra item rooms replace random dead ends.
0 Item Rooms Per Palace: • Palace items move to minor item locations. • If there aren't enough minor items to replace (based on the number of starting items and heart containers), you will get a popup saying the flags are incompatible. • If the item count depends on indeterminate flags, those flags will be re-rolled until valid. • If needed, the "Include P-Bag Caves in Item Shuffle" setting will be overriden to make room.
Random Item Rooms Per Palace: • Clouds in the entrance screen and Ironknuckle statues by the entrance elevator indicate how many items there are in the palace. • Each palace gets 0–3 item rooms (varies by palace length/style).

data.name: IncludeVanillaRoomsToolTip
data.value: If selected, the normal zelda 2 rooms will be available for palace generation. Note that rooms from palaces 1-6 may be found in any of those palaces. Has no effect on vanilla or vanilla shuffle styles.

data.name: Include40RoomsToolTip
data.value: If selected, the first batch of community-designed custom rooms from version 4.0 will be available. Has no effect on vanilla or vanilla shuffle styles.

data.name: Include50RoomsToolTip
data.value: If selected, the second batch of community-designed custom rooms from version 5.0 will be available. Has no effect on vanilla or vanilla shuffle styles.

data.name: ThunderbirdRequiredToolTip
data.value: If selected, the path to Dark Link in Great Palace must go through Thunderbird's room. The thunder spell will be required to beat the game. When unselected, Thunderbird still appears in GP, and may be required anyway if the palace style or randomized layout requires it.

data.name: RemoveThunderbirdToolTip
data.value: If selected, Thunderbird will not appear in Great Palace. For vanilla styles, his room will be removed and bypassed. For generated styles, one additional normal room will appear instead.

data.name: UseCustomRoomsFileToolTip
data.value: If selected, rooms will be based on the file CustomRooms.json instead of PalaceRooms.json . You may edit this file to control which rooms you want to use, or create your own rooms that can appear. For more details, contact Ellendar or ask on the Discord.

data.name: NumberofPalacestoCompleteToolTip
data.value: This is the number of gems you start the game with and therefor the number of palaces that must be completed before being able to enter the Great Palace. The number of required palaces is a random value between Min and Max (inclusive of both endpoints).

data.name: RestartatPalacesonGameOverToolTip
data.value: If selected, on Game Over (or Up+A) you will restart at the beginning of the palace. If unselected, this will happen only in GP (like in vanilla)

data.name: FiftyFiftyStatueCyclesBetweenJarandKnightToolTip
data.value: If selected, 50/50 statues in palaces that include them will always alternate between dropping a red jar or spawning a red Ironknuckle. If unselected, the spawning is randomly determined each stab like in vanilla.

data.name: ReduceDripperVarianceToolTip
data.value: Guarantees a blue drip after 8 consecutive red drips. After a blue drip, the next 4 are guaranteed red. (All drippers share the same count.)

data.name: ChangePalacePalettesToolTip
data.value: Changes the color palette of each palace to a new random one.

data.name: RandomizeBossItemDropToolTip
data.value: Changes the item received from defeating a boss from a key to any small item at random (red jar, blue jar, key, 1-up, or any of the 4 p-bags)

data.name: NoDuplicateRoomsByLayoutToolTip
data.value: Prevents palace generation from creating duplicate rooms. For this setting, a room is considered a duplicate if the layout of the room is the same as another, ignoring enemy sets. Has no effect on vanilla palaces. If the number of available palace rooms is too small (like when using only one room group), duplicate rooms may be included anyway as it would otherwise likely be impossible to produce a palace. Does not completely prevent duplicates for Random Walk generated palaces.

data.name: NoDuplicateRoomsByLayoutEnemiesToolTip
data.value: Prevents palace generation from creating duplicate rooms. For this setting, all different variants of a room (same layout with different enemy sets, Fairy/No Fairy, etc.) are *not* considered duplicates of each other. Has no effect on vanilla palaces. Does not completely prevent duplicates for Random Walk generated palaces.

data.name: BlockingRoomsinAnyPalaceToolTip
data.value: Allows rooms that require an item or spell to traverse to appear in any palace. Otherwise, palaces can only contain blocks according to the following table.

data.name: BossRoomsExitToToolTip
data.value:
Selects whether the boss room exits into the overworld (like in vanilla), or more palace rooms. This can be selected for all palaces, Randomly per palace, or Random but the same selection for all palaces. When a palace continues outside, there will always be an Ironknuckle statue right before the exit like in vanilla. When the palace continues, that statue will be removed.
If the palace continues after the boss, palace item rooms may be behind the boss room.

data.name: HarderCarockToolTip
data.value: Tired of just ducking in the corner and blocking? This option enables carock shooting high/low/wave beams, but he won't teleport on top of you anymore.

data.name: GPPalaceStyleToolTip
data.value: Sets the palace generator for the Great Palace. See the Wiki for more details about palace styles.

data.name: ShuffleLifeRefillAmountToolTip
data.value: Causes the life spell to recover a random amount between 1-5 bars instead of the vanilla 3. This amount is always the same throughout the seed.

data.name: ShuffleSpellLocationsToolTip
data.value: Spells will be shuffled into random towns. This also changes the spell order on the menu so each spell is in the slot corresponding to the town you got it. Has no effect if used with "Include spells in shuffle"

data.name: DisableMagicContainerRequirementsToolTip
data.value: Removes the requirement to have 5/6/7/8 magic containers to visit the wizard in the eastern towns.

data.name: RandomizeSpellSpellEnemyToolTip
data.value: Changes which enemy enemies are transformed into when the spell spell is used.

data.name: SwapUpstabandDownstabLocationToolTip
data.value: Swaps the location of the sword techniques with each other. Has no effect if used with "Include sword techniques in shuffle"

data.name: FireSpellToolTip
data.value: Controls how the fire spell is treated. • Normal: No effect. Fire spell works like normal. • Pair with Random: Pairs the fire spell with a randomly selected non-fire spell. When you cast fire, the linked spell is cast, and vice versa. • Replace with Dash: Replaces the fire spell with the dash spell, which doubles link's max speed and accelleration for the current room. If selected this might be required to clear some rooms, or to use jump + dash to cross the Saria moat. • Random: One of these options at random.

data.name: JumpAlwaysOnToolTip
data.value: Link always jumps high, like he was affected by the Jump spell. The Jump spell will still be available, but it does nothing.

data.name: DashAlwaysOnToolTip
data.value: Link always runs fast, like he was affected by the Dash spell. If fire is replaced with dash, the Dash spell will still appear, but do nothing.

data.name: PermanentBeamSwordToolTip
data.value: Link will always shoot beams from his sword, regardless of life.

data.name: ShuffleStartingItemsToolTip
data.value:
When enabled, your starting items will be randomized.
• Checked items are always included (unless you've checked more than the limit below). • Unchecked items each have a 25% chance to be included.

data.name: StartingItemLimitToolTip
data.value:
Sets an upper limit on the number of starting items.
• If you check fewer or equal to the limit, all checked items are guaranteed. • If you check more than the limit, a random selection (equal to the limit) will be chosen from your checked items. • With Shuffle Starting Items enabled, unchecked items may be added with a 25% chance each, but the total number of items will never exceed the limit.
(Note that the total number of starting items may still be below the limit, depending on the results of the random rolls.)

data.name: ShuffleStartingSpellsToolTip
data.value:
When enabled, your starting spells will be randomized.
• Checked spells are always included (unless you've checked more than the limit below). • Unchecked spells each have a 25% chance to be included.

data.name: StartingSpellLimitToolTip
data.value:
Sets an upper limit on the number of starting spells.
• If you check fewer or equal to the limit, all checked spells are guaranteed. • If you check more than the limit, a random selection (equal to the limit) will be chosen from your checked spells. • With Shuffle Starting Spells enabled, unchecked spells may be added with a 25% chance each, but the total number of spells will never exceed the limit.
(Note that the total number of starting spells may still be below the limit, depending on the results of the random rolls.)

data.name: HeartContainersToolTip
data.value:
Start Min / Max: Options: 1-8
Adjust the minimum and maximum starting hearts. The actual starting number will be randomly selected between these values (inclusive).
Total Hearts: Options: 1-8, +1, +2, +3, +4, Random
Adjusts the total number of heart containers available: • 1-8: Set the exact total. • +1, +2, +3, +4: Sets the total to the starting hearts plus the specified amount. • Random: Chooses a total randomly between starting hearts and 8.
• If the total is less than 4 above the starting count, some heart container pick-ups in the game will be replaced with minor items. • If the total exceeds the starting count by more than 4, minor items in the item shuffle will be replaced with heart containers until the total is met. ◦ If needed, the "Include P-Bag Caves in Item Shuffle" setting will be overriden to make room.

data.name: StartingLevelsToolTip
data.value: Select Link's starting Attack / Magic / Life levels.

data.name: StartingSwordTechniquesToolTip
data.value: Select which sword techniques to begin with.

data.name: StartingLivesToolTip
data.value:
Select the number of lives Link starts with when the game begins or on game over.
Random selects a random number of starting lives between 2 and 5.

data.name: RandomFlagRateToolTip
data.value: For flags set to an indeterminate value (question mark), those flags will be on or off at random, at the freqency specified by this flag.
